	The aggregate market value of the registrant's voting and non-voting common equity held by non-affiliates of the registrant, based upon the closing price of the registrant's common stock on the last business day of the registrant's most recently completed second fiscal quarter ($6.52), was $14,196,133. &#160;Solely for the purpose of this calculation, shares held by directors and executive officers of the registrant have been excluded. &#160;Such exclusion should not be deemed a determination or an admission by the registrant that such individuals are, in fact, affiliates of the registrant.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The number of outstanding shares of the registrant's common stock was 2,605,719 as of March 26, 2013.
</DIV>

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Forward-Looking Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Information included or incorporated by reference in this Annual Report on Form 10-K may contain forward-looking statements. &#160;This information may involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors that may cause our actual results, performance or achievements to be materially different than the future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by any forward-looking statements. &#160;Forward-looking statements, which involve assumptions and describe our future plans, strategies and expectations, are generally identifiable by use of the words "may," "should," "expect," "anticipate," "estimate," "believe," "intend" or "project" or the negative of these words or other variations on these words or comparable terminology.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	This Annual Report on Form 10-K contains forward-looking statements, including statements regarding, among other things, (a) our projected sales and profitability, (b) our growth strategies, (c) anticipated trends in our industry, (d) our future financing plans and (e) our anticipated needs for working capital. &#160;These statements may be found under "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" and "Business," as well as in this Annual Report generally. &#160;Actual events or results may differ materially from those discussed in forward-looking statements as a result of various factors, including, without limitation, the risks outlined under "Risk Factors" and matters described in this Annual Report generally. &#160;In light of these risks and uncertainties, there can be no assurance that the forward-looking statements contained in this Annual Report will in fact be accurate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Further, we do not undertake any obligation to update publicly any forward-looking statements. &#160;As a result, you should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements.

<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 39.6PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Item 1.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.26PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The LGL Group, Inc., incorporated in 1928 under the laws of the State of Indiana and reincorporated under the laws of the State of Delaware in 2007, is a globally-positioned producer of industrial and commercial products and services that is currently focused on the design and manufacture of highly-engineered electronic components and subsystems. &#160;The LGL Group, Inc. and its subsidiaries (collectively, the "Company") maintains its executive offices at 2525 Shader Road, Orlando, Florida, 32804. &#160;The Company's telephone number is (407) 298-2000. &#160;The Company's common stock is traded on NYSE MKT under the ticker symbol "LGL".
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company operates through its principal subsidiary, M-tron Industries, Inc. ("Mtron"), which includes the operations of its subsidiary, M-tron Industries, Ltd., as well as the operations of its subsidiary, Piezo Technology, Inc. ("PTI") and PTI's subsidiary Piezo Technology India Private Ltd. &#160;The combined operations of Mtron and PTI and their subsidiaries are referred to herein as "MtronPTI." &#160;MtronPTI has operations in Orlando, Florida, Yankton, South Dakota, Yantai, China and Noida, India. &#160;MtronPTI also has sales offices in Hong Kong and Shanghai, China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company's business development strategy is to expand its existing operations primarily through organic growth, and joint venture or merger and acquisition opportunities. &#160;It may, from time to time, consider the acquisition of other assets or businesses that are not related to its present businesses. &#160;However, the Company's ability to consummate an acquisition may be dependent on its ability to obtain financing, which may be hindered by our results of operations, our financial condition, or by the prevailing global economic and financial market conditions.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Overview of MtronPTI
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI designs, manufactures and sells standard and custom-engineered electronic components that are used primarily to control the frequency or timing of signals in electronic circuits. &#160;Its devices, which are commonly called frequency control devices, are used extensively in infrastructure equipment for the telecommunications and network equipment industries, as well as in electronic systems for military applications, avionics, earth-orbiting satellites, medical devices, instrumentation, industrial devices and global positioning systems.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	1
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's frequency control devices consist of packaged quartz crystals, crystal oscillators and electronic filters. &#160;Its products produce an electrical signal that has the following attributes:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8210;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Accuracy: &#160;the measure of error between the specified frequency and the produced frequency;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8210;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Stability: &#160;the frequency of the signal does not vary significantly when the product is subjected to a range of operating environments; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8210;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Low electronic noise: &#160;the signal does not add interfering signals that can degrade the performance of electronic systems.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI has more than 45 years of experience designing, manufacturing and marketing crystal-based frequency control products. &#160;Its customers rely on the skills of MtronPTI's engineering and design team to help solve frequency control problems during all phases of their products' life cycles, including product design, prototyping, manufacturing, and subsequent product improvements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MtronPTI's Objectives
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI has built on the strength of its core expertise in packaged quartz crystal oscillator and electronic filter technologies to become the supplier of choice to original equipment manufacturers ("OEMs") that supply equipment with high-performance frequency control needs. &#160;MtronPTI intends to grow through strong penetration of the filter and timing management portion of the electronics industry. &#160;MtronPTI has made progress in its efforts to grow beyond being more than a component company by expanding its product offerings and focusing a portion of its development efforts towards timing module and RF subsystem products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI focuses on technical resources, including design and engineering personnel, to enable it to provide a higher level of design and engineering support to existing and potential customers. &#160;It believes that technical participation with its OEM customers in the early stages of their design process results in MtronPTI's frequency control devices being designed into their products more regularly.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI has a long-standing relationship with offshore contract manufacturers to take advantage of lower manufacturing costs. &#160;These contract manufacturers have added increased technological support and infrastructure to increase capacity on MtronPTI's behalf. &#160;MtronPTI's objective is to reduce the time it takes to manufacture its products, which will result in better service to its customers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI is continuing its efforts to design, manufacture and sell devices that offer higher frequencies, greater precision or smaller packages than its current products. &#160;It also plans to expand its offering of integrated timing modules and RF subsystems to offer broader solutions to its customers. &#160;It intends to achieve this through a combination of focused research and development, and strategic acquisitions, if they are appropriate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI believes that it may be able to enhance its business opportunities significantly by acquiring technology, product portfolios, new design capabilities, and/or access to a portfolio of targeted customers. &#160;Some of these may offer immediate sales opportunities, while others may meet longer-term objectives. &#160;It plans to pursue these opportunities by making strategic acquisitions or by acquiring or licensing technology.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Products
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's products are high quality, reliable, technically advanced frequency control devices, including packaged quartz crystals, oscillators incorporating those crystals and electronic filter products. &#160;The October 2002 acquisition of Champion Technologies provided MtronPTI an entry to the timing modules market. &#160;The September 2004 acquisition of PTI provided MtronPTI with its families of very precise oven-controlled crystal oscillators and its electronic filter products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	2
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI designs and produces a wide range of packaged quartz crystals, quartz crystal-based oscillators and electronic filter products. &#160;The Packaged Crystal is a single crystal in a hermetically sealed package that is used by electronic equipment manufacturers, along with their own electronic circuitry, to build oscillators for frequency control in their electronic devices. &#160;The Clock Oscillator is the simplest of its oscillators. &#160;It is a self-contained package with a crystal and electronic circuitry that is used as a subsystem by electronic equipment manufacturers to provide frequency control for their devices. &#160;The Voltage Controlled Crystal Oscillator ("VCXO") is a variable frequency oscillator whose frequency can be changed by varying the control voltage to the oscillator. &#160;The Temperature Compensated Crystal Oscillator ("TCXO") is a stable oscillator designed for use over a range of temperatures. &#160;Oven-Controlled Crystal Oscillators ("OCXO") are designed to produce a much higher level of stability over a wide range of operating conditions with very low phase noise. &#160;Electronic filters use either crystal technology, precise manufacturing of inductive/capacitive circuits, or low and high-powered cavity designs to provide filters with carefully defined capabilities to filter out unwanted portions of a timing signal. &#160;This variety of features in MtronPTI's product family offers the designers at OEMs a range of options they can utilize to add performance features to their products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Currently, MtronPTI's oscillator products operate at frequencies ranging from 2 kilohertz to over 1.4 gigahertz, which constitute most of the oscillator frequencies that are now in use in its target markets. &#160;It offers crystal and inductive/capacitive filters with central frequencies from a Direct Current to 15 gigahertz. &#160;However, many of its products, through amplification or other means, are ultimately incorporated into products that operate at higher frequencies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The vast majority of MtronPTI's products are custom-designed for requirements of specific OEM systems. &#160;The expected business life of these products ranges from less than one year to more than 10 years, depending on the application. &#160;Some of the customizations are modest changes to existing product designs, while others are major product redesigns or new product platforms. &#160;MtronPTI monitors the level of these major new designs and uses them as an internal metric of its engineering effectiveness. &#160;Typically, approximately 10 to 15% of MtronPTI's revenue has come from major new designs or new product platforms that have been introduced in the preceding three years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's products are employed in numerous infrastructure applications within the telecommunications industry, including computer and telephone network switches, high-speed gigabit Ethernet, modems, wireless transmitters/receivers, multiplexers, data recovery/regeneration devices, fiber channel networks, repeaters, data transceivers, line interface devices, communications satellites, and base station controllers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Crystal, oscillator and filter products are also designed for military, avionics, and industrial applications. &#160;Military uses include flexible communication platforms, remote sensing, personnel protection, radar, guidance and armaments. &#160;Avionics applications include radar, ground and flight control systems. &#160;Industrial applications include security systems, metering systems, electronic test instruments and industrial control systems. &#160;MtronPTI's products are also used in medical instrumentation, energy exploration, smart grid, as well as in various computer peripheral equipment such as storage devices, printers, modems, monitors, video cards and sound cards.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's hybrid timing module products combine timing system functions, including analog, digital and software, into a small, self-contained module to reduce design time and risk by combining precision oscillators (quartz or MEMs) with GPS clock receivers and/or packet synchronization software based on the IEEE 1588 standard.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Manufacturing and Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's operations are located in Orlando, Florida, Yankton, South Dakota, Yantai, China and Noida, India. &#160;MtronPTI owns one building in Orlando, Florida, containing approximately 71,000 square feet on approximately seven acres of land. &#160;MtronPTI owns two buildings in Yankton, South Dakota, containing a combined total of approximately 32,000 square feet on approximately 11 acres of land. The Company leases approximately 13,000 square feet of office and manufacturing space in Noida, India, approximately 1,200 square feet of office space in Hong Kong, approximately 400 square feet of office space in Shanghai, China, and approximately 1,100 square feet of office space in Yantai, China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	3
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI has established long-term relationships with several contract manufacturers in Asia. &#160;Approximately 15.4% of MtronPTI's revenues in 2012 were attributable to one such contract manufacturer with production locations in both Korea and China. &#160;MtronPTI maintains a rigorous quality control system and is an ISO 9001/2008 and AS 9100 Rev. C qualified manufacturer. &#160;MtronPTI's Hong Kong subsidiary (M-tron Industries, Ltd.) does not manufacture, but acts as a buying agent, regional warehouse, quality control and sales representative for its parent company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Research and development expense was approximately $2,005,000 and $1,878,000 in 2012 and 2011, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Marketing and Sales
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI markets and sells its products through a variety of channels and agents. Nearly all of MtronPTI's products are sold into a specific design application at an OEM. &#160;Some of the products are sold directly to the OEM, some of the products are sold to an Electronic Manufacturing Services ("EMS") company, which assembles them into final use products on behalf of the OEM, and some are sold to an electronics distributor who resells them to the OEM or EMS companies. &#160;MtronPTI uses a combination of employees, external manufacturer representatives and electronics distributors to market and sell its products. &#160;An important part of the sales process is getting formal OEM confirmation of product suitability for use in a specific system design or a "design-win."
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In most cases, MtronPTI's customers may cancel their respective orders without penalty up to 60 days prior to the scheduled shipping date. &#160;Within 60 days of the scheduled shipping date, cancellation fees may apply, up to 100% of the contract price.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Customers
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI markets and sells its frequency control devices primarily to:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">

	OEMs of communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and medical equipment;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">

</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8210;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Distributors who sell to OEMs and contract manufacturers.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In 2012, MtronPTI's largest customer, an electronics contract manufacturing company, accounted for $2,914,000, or 9.8%, of the Company's total revenues, compared to $3,680,000, or 10.3%, in 2011. &#160;At December 31, 2012, MtronPTI's three largest customers accounted for approximately $1,880,000 of accounts receivable, or 42.4% of MtronPTI's accounts receivable, compared to approximately $1,441,000, or 33.4%, for MtronPTI's three largest customers in 2011. The Company carefully evaluates the creditworthiness of its customers in deciding to extend credit, and utilized letters of credit to further limit credit risk for export sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Seasonality
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's business is not seasonal.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Domestic Revenues
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's domestic revenues were $15,087,000 in 2012, or 50.8% of total consolidated revenues, compared to $15,645,000, or 43.8% of total consolidated revenues, in 2011.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	4
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	International Revenues
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's international revenues were $14,619,000 in 2012, or 49.2% of total consolidated revenues, compared to $20,037,000, or 56.2% of total consolidated revenues, in 2011. &#160;In each of 2012 and 2011, these revenues were derived mainly from customers in Malaysia and China, with additional significant sales in Thailand and Mexico. &#160;MtronPTI avoids significant currency exchange risk by transacting and settling substantially all international sales in United States dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Risks Attendant to Foreign Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	See Part I, Item 1A. "Risk Factors," "We have significant international operations and sales to customers outside of the United States that subject us to certain business, economic and political risks," for a discussion of the risks attendant to our foreign operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Order Backlog
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2012, MtronPTI's order backlog was $8,703,000, which was an increase of 0.8% compared to a backlog of $8,634,000 at December 31, 2011. &#160;
</FONT>
	The backlog of unfilled orders includes amounts based on signed contracts as well as agreed letters of intent, which we have determined are firm orders and likely to proceed.&#160;&#160;Although backlog represents only firm orders that are considered likely to be fulfilled within the 12 months following receipt of the order, cancellations or scope adjustments may and do occur.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Order backlog is adjusted quarterly to reflect project cancellations, deferrals, revised project scope and cost, and sales of subsidiaries, if any. &#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The
</FONT>
	Company
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	expects to fill its entire 2012 order backlog in 2013, but cannot provide assurances as to what portion of the order backlog will be fulfilled in a given year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Raw Materials
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Most raw materials used in the production of MtronPTI products are available in adequate supply from a number of sources. &#160;The prices of these raw materials are relatively stable. &#160;However, some raw materials, including printed circuit boards, quartz, and certain metals including steel, aluminum, silver, gold, tantalum and palladium, are subject to greater supply fluctuations and price volatility as experienced over recent years. &#160;The Company generally has been able to include some cost increases in its pricing, but in some cases margins were adversely impacted.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Competition
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Frequency control devices are sold in a highly competitive industry. &#160;There are numerous domestic and international manufacturers who are capable of providing custom designed quartz crystals, oscillators and electronic filters comparable in quality and performance to MtronPTI's products. &#160;Competitors include, but are not limited to, Vectron International and K&amp;L Microwave (divisions of Dover Corporation), CTS Corporation, Rakon Limited and Saronix (a division of Pericom Semiconductor Corporation). &#160;MtronPTI does not operate in the same markets as high volume manufacturers of standard products; rather it focuses on manufacturing lower volumes of more precise, custom designed frequency control devices. &#160;Many of MtronPTI's competitors and potential competitors have substantially greater financial, engineering, manufacturing and marketing resources than MtronPTI.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI seeks to manufacture custom-designed, high-performance crystals and oscillators, which it believes it can sell competitively based upon performance, quality, order response time and a high level of engineering support. &#160;MtronPTI believes that its main competitive advantages include its technical skill, intellectual property, and ability to bring to customers new product designs as well as final manufactured products faster than its competitors, thus being more responsive to its customers' design and supply chain requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Intellectual Property
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI has no patents, trademarks or licenses that are considered to be significant to its business or operations. &#160;Rather, MtronPTI believes that its technological position depends primarily on the technical competence
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	5
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	and creative ability of its engineering and technical staff in areas of product design and manufacturing processes, including their ability to customize to meet difficult specifications, as well as proprietary know-how and information.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Employees
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	As of December 31, 2012, the Company employed 184 people (full-time equivalents): &#160;2 within corporate headquarters and 182 within its subsidiary, MtronPTI, which includes 59 in Yankton, South Dakota, 100 in Orlando, Florida, 9 in Hong Kong, 8 in Noida, India, 5 in Shanghai, China and 1 in Yantai, China. &#160;In 2012, there was a net reduction in its headcount by 15 as part of its continuing efforts to improve operational efficiency. &#160;None of its employees are represented by a labor union and the Company considers its employee relations to be good.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Environmental
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The Company's manufacturing operations, products, and/or product packaging are subject to environmental laws and regulations governing air emissions, wastewater discharges, and the handling, disposal and remediation of hazardous substances, wastes and other chemicals. &#160;In addition, more stringent environmental regulations may be enacted in the future, both within the United States and internationally, and we cannot presently determine the modifications, if any, in the Company's operations that any future regulations might require, or the cost of compliance that would be associated with these regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	To date, capital expenditures, earnings and competitive position of the Company have not been materially affected by compliance with current federal, state, and local laws and regulations (domestic and foreign) relating to the protection of the environment. &#160;However, the Company cannot predict the effect of future laws and regulations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Long-Lived Assets
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Long-lived assets, including intangible assets subject to amortization, are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount thereof may not be recoverable. &#160;Management assesses the recoverability of the carrying cost of the assets based on a review of projected undiscounted cash flows. &#160;If an asset is held for sale, management reviews its estimated fair value less selling costs. Fair value is determined using pertinent market information, including appraisals or broker's estimates, and/or projected discounted cash flows. In the event an impairment loss is identified, it is recognized based on the amount by which the carrying value exceeds the estimated fair value of the long-lived asset.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	6
</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Item 1A.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.26PT" ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Risk Factors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	You should carefully consider the risks described below before making a decision to invest in our common stock. &#160;If any of these risks actually occurs, our business financial condition, results of operations, or prospects could be materially adversely affected. &#160;This could cause the trading price of our common stock to decline and a loss of all or part of your investment. &#160;The risks described below are not the only ones facing us. &#160;Additional risks not currently known to us or that we currently believe to be immaterial may also impair the Company's business operations and our liquidity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Risks Related to Our Business and Industry
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We are dependent on a single line of business.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We are currently dedicated to manufacturing and marketing standard and custom-engineered electronic components that are used primarily to control the frequency or timing of signals in electronic circuits, and we do not offer any other products. &#160;Virtually all of MtronPTI's 2012 and 2011 revenues came from sales of frequency control devices, which consist of packaged quartz crystals, oscillator modules, electronic filters and integrated modules. &#160;We expect that this product line will continue to account for substantially all of MtronPTI's revenues in 2013.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Given our reliance on this single line of business, any decline in demand for this product line or failure to achieve continued market acceptance of existing and new versions of this product line may harm MtronPTI's business and our financial condition. &#160;Additionally, unfavorable market conditions affecting this line of business would likely have a disproportionate impact on us in comparison with certain competitors, who have more diversified operations and multiple lines of business. &#160;Should this line of business fail to generate sufficient sales to support ongoing operations, there can be no assurance that we will be able to develop alternate business lines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Our operating results vary significantly from period to period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We experience fluctuations in our operating results. Some of the principal factors that contribute to these fluctuations include: changes in demand for our products; our effectiveness in managing manufacturing processes, costs and inventory; our effectiveness in engineering and qualifying new product designs with our OEM customers and in managing the risks associated with bringing those new products into production; changes in the cost and availability of raw materials, which often occur in the electronics manufacturing industry and which affect our margins and our ability to meet delivery schedules; macroeconomic and served industry conditions; and events that may affect our production capabilities, such as labor conditions and political instability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In addition, due to the prevailing economic climate and competitive differences between the various market segments which we serve, the mix of sales between our communications, networking, military, avionics, industrial and instrumentation market segments may affect our operating results from period to period. We had a net loss in 2012, and we are uncertain as to our ability to return to profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We had a net loss of ($1,320,000) for the year ended December 31, 2012. &#160;Our revenues are derived solely from our operating subsidiary, MtronPTI, and its future rate of growth and profitability are highly dependent on the development and growth of demand for our products in the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets, which are cyclical. We cannot be certain whether we will generate sufficient revenues or sufficiently manage expenses to return to profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We have a large customer that accounts for a significant portion of our revenues, and the loss of this customer, or decrease in their demand for our products, could have a material adverse effect on our results.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In 2012, MtronPTI's largest customer, an electronics contract manufacturing company, accounted for $2,914,000, or 9.8%, of the Company's total revenues, compared to $3,680,000, or 10.3%, in 2011. The loss of this customer, or a decrease in their demand for our products, could have a material adverse effect on our results.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	7
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A relatively small number of customers account for a significant portion of our accounts receivable, and the insolvency of any of these customers could have a material adverse impact on our liquidity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In 2012, MtronPTI's three largest customers accounted for approximately $1,880,000, or 42.4%, of accounts receivable, compared to approximately $1,441,000, or 33.4%, as compared to 2011. &#160;The insolvency of any of these customers could have a material adverse impact on our liquidity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MtronPTI's order backlog may not be indicative of future revenues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	MtronPTI's order backlog comprises orders that are subject to specific production release, orders under written contracts, oral and written orders from customers with which MtronPTI has had long-standing relationships and written purchase orders from sales representatives. &#160;MtronPTI's customers may order components from multiple sources to ensure timely delivery when backlog is particularly long and may cancel or defer orders without significant penalty. &#160;They also may cancel orders when business is weak and inventories are excessive. &#160;As a result, the Company cannot provide assurances as to the portion of backlog orders to be filled in a given year, and MtronPTI's order backlog as of any particular date may not be representative of actual revenues for any subsequent period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We are a holding company, and therefore are dependent upon the operations of our subsidiaries to meet our obligations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We are a holding company that transacts business through our operating subsidiaries. &#160;Our primary assets are the shares of our operating subsidiaries. &#160;Our ability to meet our operating requirements and to make other payments depends on the surplus and earnings of our subsidiaries and their ability to pay dividends or to advance or repay funds. &#160;The ability of our subsidiaries to pay dividends or make other distributions to the Company is subject to certain limitations under our existing credit facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MtronPTI relies upon a limited number of contract manufacturers for a significant portion of its finished products, and a disruption in those relationships could have a negative impact on our revenues.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In 2012, approximately 15.4% of our revenue was attributable to finished products that were manufactured by an independent contract manufacturer with production locations in both Korea and China (as compared to 14.7% in 2011). &#160;We expect this manufacturer to continue to account for a similar portion of our total revenue in 2013 and the next several years. &#160;We do not have a written, long-term supply contract with this manufacturer. &#160;If this manufacturer becomes unable to provide products in the quantities needed, or at acceptable prices, we would have to identify and qualify acceptable replacement manufacturers or manufacture the products internally. &#160;Due to specific product knowledge and process capability, we could encounter difficulties in locating, qualifying and entering into arrangements with replacement manufacturers. &#160;As a result, a reduction in the production capability or financial viability of this manufacturer, or a termination of, or significant interruption in, our relationship with this manufacturer, may adversely affect our results of operations and our financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MtronPTI's future rate of growth and profitability are highly dependent on the development and growth of the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets, which are cyclical.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	In 2012, the majority of MtronPTI's revenues were derived from sales to manufacturers of equipment for the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets for frequency control devices, including indirect sales through distributors and contract manufacturers. &#160;In 2013, MtronPTI expects a significant portion of its revenues to continue to be derived from sales to these manufacturers. &#160;Often OEMs and other service providers within these markets have experienced periods of capacity shortage and periods of excess capacity, as well as periods of either high or low demand for their products. &#160;In periods of excess capacity or low demand, purchases of capital equipment may be curtailed, including equipment that incorporates MtronPTI's products. &#160;A slowdown, whether due to cyclical, macroeconomic or other factors, in the manufacture and purchase of equipment for these markets could substantially reduce MtronPTI's net sales and operating results and adversely affect our financial condition. &#160;Moreover, if these markets fail to grow as expected, MtronPTI may be unable to maintain or grow its revenue.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
	8
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	The multiple variables which affect the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets for equipment that require frequency control devices, as well as the number of parties involved in the supply chain and manufacturing process, can impact inventory levels and lead to supply chain inefficiencies. &#160;As a result of these complexities, MtronPTI has limited visibility to forecast revenue projections accurately for the near and medium-term timeframes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Market share of frequency control devices with equipment manufacturers in the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets may change over time, reducing the value of our relationships with our existing customer base.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We have developed long-term relationships with our existing customers, including pricing contracts, custom designs and approved vendor status. &#160;If these customers lose share to equipment manufacturers in the communications, networking, military, avionics, instrumentation and industrial markets with whom we do not have similar relationships, our ability to maintain revenue, margin or operating performance may be adversely affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	We may make acquisitions that are not successful, or we may fail to integrate acquired businesses into our operations properly.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	We intend to explore opportunities to buy other businesses or technologies that could complement, enhance or expand our current business or product lines, or that might otherwise offer us growth opportunities. &#160;We may have difficulty finding such opportunities or, if such opportunities are identified, we may not be able to complete such transactions for reasons including a failure to secure necessary financing.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Any transactions that we are able to identify and complete may involve a number of risks, including:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8210;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The diversion of our management's attention from the management of our existing business to the integration of the operations and personnel of the acquired or combined business or joint venture;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Due diligence may not identify material business risks;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Possible adverse effects on our operating results during the integration process;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Substantial acquisition-related expenses, which would reduce our net income, if any, in future years;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 54PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
